Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hey, Ellie! I’ve actually been doing a bit better. I tried the free writing exercise you suggested.
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
It felt really good to just let my thoughts flow. I didn’t worry about making it perfect, and I wrote for about fifteen minutes.
That’s amazing! What did you write about?
I wrote about my experiences with gambling and how it felt to lose everything. It was kind of cathartic.
That’s a powerful topic. How did it feel to put those feelings on paper?
It felt like I was releasing some pent-up emotions. I didn’t realize how much I needed to express that.
I’m so glad to hear that! Writing can be a wonderful tool for processing emotions. Do you think you’ll continue with it?
Definitely. I think I’ll make it a regular thing.
That’s great! You’re taking positive steps. Have you had a chance to practice the breathing exercises before bed?
Yes! I’ve been doing it for about a week now, and I think it’s helping. I’ve been sleeping a bit better.
That’s wonderful news! Consistency is key. How are you feeling overall with your sleep and mood?
I still have my off days, but I’m feeling a bit more hopeful, which is nice.
That’s a positive shift! It sounds like you’re making progress. Have you noticed any changes in your anger towards others?
Yeah, I’ve been trying to remind myself that everyone has their own battles. It’s still hard sometimes, but I’m working on it.
That’s a great mindset to have. It sounds like you’re becoming more compassionate towards others, which can be really healing for you as well.
Thanks, I appreciate that. I’m trying to be more understanding.
It’s a journey, and you’re doing well. Are there any specific situations that still trigger that anger for you?
Not really, just the usual stuff I see on the streets. But I’m trying to manage my reactions better.
That’s a healthy approach. Have you thought more about volunteering since we last talked?
Yes, I looked up some local organizations. I think I might start volunteering at a food bank.
That sounds like a fantastic opportunity! Helping others can be really fulfilling. When do you think you’ll start?
I’m planning to go this weekend. I’m a little nervous, but I think it’ll be good for me.
It’s normal to feel nervous before starting something new. Just remember, you’re doing this to help others and yourself.
Yeah, I’ll keep that in mind.
How do you feel about your family relationships? You mentioned feeling distant from your mother.
Still the same. I haven’t reached out. I just don’t know what to say.
That’s understandable. It can be tough to bridge those gaps. Would you be open to exploring ways to reconnect with her?
Maybe. I guess I’ve thought about it, but I’m not sure if it’s worth it.
It could be worth exploring. Even a simple message to check in could open the door to communication.
Yeah, I suppose.
It’s up to you, of course. Just know that it’s okay to take small steps.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
Of course! I’m here to help. Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think we covered a lot. I’m feeling good about the writing and volunteering.
That’s great to hear! Let’s continue to build on that momentum. I’m looking forward to hearing about your experiences next time.
Me too! Thanks for everything.
You’re welcome! Have a great week, and take care.
Bye!
Bye!
